intro: Baeoterpe brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved baeoterpe, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Baeoterpe brevifolia is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
